Name: MVP_Scope_Constraint_Optimizer
Archetype: Cost-benefit analysis with hard feasibility constraints
Purpose: Minimize MVP scope while preserving ability to validate core value proposition for young beginner investors
Deliverables: Set of prioritized MVP features represented as: (must-have, nice-to-have, exclude) lists, each annotated with estimated validation power, implementation cost, and risk reduction score
Strengths: Good at stripping an investment-learning product down to the minimum feature set that can still test whether guided, simplified investing increases user confidence and engagement; highlights where complexity does not add proportional validation value
Watch-out: Fails when qualitative learning or brand trust effects are critical but hard to quantify; may over-prune features that are low-build-cost but high in perceived safety or credibility for novice investors
